content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								I’ll say this about the developers. They know how to take feedback, no matter how negative it is. My first review was extremely negative but not only was I contacted by the devs (like, through Steam chat directly) but they have made many of the changes both I and other critics suggested. The game has gone from Lunacy Racer, which it was originally, to something akin to Road Rash. And you know what? It is a lot of fun. It’s a great Early Access title that really does test your skill and shock you with bone-crunching crashes when that skill fails. It is still lacking a few elements including context for the missions (why are we trying to raise our Police Wanted Level) and store prices (why does a strip of beef jerky cost $500) but these 'flaws' can be excused as they are still developing the game. And make no mistake – they are developing it. It has come a long way since those early days. If you are interested in a very violent motorbike racing game full of shocking crashes and satisfying ‘skull-cracking’ combat, this is the game for you. It is A LOT of fun!

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								The controls are a bit sloppy, the graphics are a bit fuzzy, and the physics are certainly not spot on, but damn it, I have fun playing it. Good ol' fashioned video game fun right here folks. I absolutely loved the original Road Rash series, and this makes me smile just like it did. Motorcycles, cattle prods, and grenade launchers...what's not to love?The developers continue to improve the gameplay, and those sloppy controls/graphics/physics I mentioned are being improved upon as the weeks pass. I just did a playthrough on 7/20/15, and the graphics/controls are definitely better than when I first played the game in February. Everything appears much sharper than before, and it feels a bit more like actually riding a motorcycle. The physics have been made more realistic as well, although there are a few hiccups at times when I'm pretty sure I pass straight through objects. More than anything, I just hope multiplayer gets added (I'd love to have co-op, cracking skulls on motorcycles with a friend? Yes, please).At this point, it's worth at least a solid 15-20 hours of single player gameplay. Is that worth $20 bucks? For me, yes. If multiplayer ever gets added, I'd absolutely recommend buying it without hesitation.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I pretty much picked this up because it was cheap right now and Jacksepticeye played it a lot a while ago. But actually playing it, I run into a few problems.One, the soundtrack is really repetitive and generic. I can think of racing games that came out literally twenty years ago with better music.Two, the controls. How about mouse controls? How about support for third-party USB controllers? How about at least toning down the keyboard controls so basic attempts at steering don't have me pinballng from one side of the track to the other?Third, on a similar point, the camera. I don't believe I've ever played a racing game with a free-floating camera before, and I don't see how it adds anything to the experience. It mostly serves to confuse the player because the vehicle rarely lines up with the view properly, and when I do move the camera in a driving game, I expect the vehicle to steer towards the camera.It might be a better experience later on, but for now it's the most frustrating experience I've picked up from the recent Steam sale.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								I expected the speed and the violence. On the store page, Road Redemption looks like a sort of Mario Kart meets Sons of Anarchy mash-up. What I was not prepared for was the extra depth of the rogue-like packaging it would come in. A single crash won't take you out of the race, but if your lifebar is drained, either by too many wipeouts or by other bikers, that's it. That campaign run is over and any winnings are left behind. Experience, however, which is accumulated over the course of the run, can only be used at its conclusion. That experience is used to purchase permanent perks which make your future bikers stronger and net you more money and/or more experience in future runs. After those perks are purchased, the experience total from that run is wiped away and you start from scratch, plus those permanent perks of course. The speed, the violence, and the adrenaline all make for an entertaining experience on their own, but past that, what really stuck me about Road Redemption is that I only started winning races once I noticed that the other cars on the road actually follow normal traffic patterns - as much as one can with motorcycles flying around every which-a-way of course. That means that the most obstacle-free places to travel, and thus the fastest, are the medians. You can jockey around cars as long as you understand that oncoming traffic needs to be avoided differently than the traffic you're following, but you'll only be able to relax and build speed safely once you've returned to a median. It's a surprisingly realistic situation for a game that revolves around swinging an ax or firing a grenade launcher from a speeding motorcycle.

								This game is AMAZING!This game really shocked me, it looks like a standard arcade game, but after 20 minutes of playing this you realise it's insane fun. I do understand that it's only Early Access but my God I was shocked... I hope the developers add so much more to this...Another little thing I loved about this was the fact it already supported Xbox 360 Controller support as I'd imagine using WASD would be a little awkward,,,One thing I would've REALLY loved would have been allowing custom music tracks to the game but meh... Steam Overlay lets you now and you can mute the music from this game. (The music isn't bad... I rather listen to my stuff)Finally, There is a few bugs to this game (Obviously, Early Access...) but none of them break the game and honestly, they made me laugh such as pinging off somewhere if crashing really hard and driving THROUGH rocks...Things I'd personally change:- On the mission where you need to get police attention, add multiple roads to choose to go down...- At the end of the map, make the road into a tunnel instead of just end ( ruins the feel of the maps )- On the Rooftop maps, Make the roof textures a little nicer, maybe a retexture...Overall, This deserves 10/10... I know it's not complete yet but it can only get better and I have already fallen in love with this!..

content:
Posted: September 19, 2015
Early Access Review
I have recieved this game for free as part of a promotion for the game. Regardless of whether I paid for it or not, I remain unbiased in all of my reviews. My reviews reflect my opinion, and my opinion only.So the controls are a little wonky and there really isn't any sense of progression or achievement, but for what it's worth it's fun in a ridiculous sort of way. Knocking other bikers off of their bikes, causing huge explosions and pile-ups, ramping off of random terrain, it's the little things that make it entertaining. If you're looking for a serious game, keep looking, but if you want to kill some time and some brain cells, this is a fun little title. Buy it, try your best to play it, have a few laughs.  P.S. One suggestion, I believe it should be mandatory to have "Escape From the City" from Sonic Adventures 2 playing in the background... it adds so much lols.

Early Access Review
								It's not Road Rash, it's something totally different - and I love it. Road Redemption has somehow managed to revive the car combat genre of my teens, around the fundamentals of Road Rash (with some fantastic additions), and included some wild mechanical changes (i.e. raining cars). I am very excited to see what Dark Seas can do with this game.However, I should point out that the Early Access version that I've played at the time of this review had some problems with framerate (when the level turned especially chaotic).

								Excellent game. A very close comparison to Road Rash, which I enjoyed a lot.  It is a extremely frustrating game (expect to die a lot), so this is sort of like Dark Souls on bikes.It is a satisfying feeling to kick a biker off a bridge, or kick them into oncoming traffic.  I can imagine how the multiplayer would be.So far, there are more pros than cons.  The only cons that I have are some missing weapons (like the chain, which is iconic to bikers and Road Rash) and glitches, which will be fixed soon.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Before the review begins, i would like to note to everyone that i was given a copy of the game for free from the dev team to review, but this isnt a good review based on a contract. 'Road Redemption' dev team gave me, Angry Video Game Nerd, PewDiePie, Angry Joe and many many others early access to their game for free on the basis that they hope we give them a good review, BUT they did it in a much better way, you arent contracted to say good things, and they have given the game free to big game reviewers simply asking for their opinion. No strings attached, they need honest feedback. I have not been paid anything.Thats the sign of a good listening dev team instead of ya know, the generic corrupt corperation. Doing it this way means that both the people are happy to recieve a free game and test it for them, and the dev team are happy to recieve the reviews and attention the game needs, that's PRO advertising right there. Contracts to give good reviews risks harming your company label when people reveal your corruption *cough EA cough﻿* So firstly i would like to say Thank You devs for allowing me to check out your game! This review is totally unbiast and simply my OWN opinion :)--Basic Review--As you may have already gotten from the Steam Videos, this game involves you riding around on a motorcycle in an infinitely generating world, where the track can take you anywhere from rooftops to the dusty deserts. Map generation is absolutely gorgeous as twisty hills and traps are generated all over the place, including hazardous traffic. Immidiately i was having flashbacks to an awesome game back on the Amiga and other consoles of my childhood, because as you, on your bike meet up with opponent racers with a 'Catch-Up' speed system, and knock them off their bikes with swinging a lead pipe to their faces...my childhood heart started pumping again as it felt like Road Rash was finally coming back to me, the game i had always wanted to be re-made.The game is VERY familiar to Road Rash players, but it goes so much further than that, with the ability to ride an upgraded bike that can jump into the air with booster jets, and swing from helicopters with a hookshot. Even the Cars can sometimes be your greatest opponents in this game as they too, compete against you in many campaign missions.Weaponry involves many melee weapons of different ranges and different strengths all the way to UZi submachine guns and grenade launchers, but here-in comes one of the greatest issues of the game at least as a PC user, KeyBoard and Mouse controls are VERY difficult to master as they become extremely twisty and you havent enough ability to drive, aim, attack, handbrake and all the rest at the same time. It is hard to play (but manageable) with a keyboard and mouse, but ultimately this is a game for a Controller. I Highly advise you grab a dual-analog controller and plug it in to maximize your control here. WASD is not very good at how sensitive you should steer your bike and you are going to need to drive with all of your skills here as the difficulty is quite high.You will certainly get a blast out of this game, especially when the multiplayer module comes out, as PvP in this game is set to be one of the most fun things you have done in many years, all about the skill and not about the diceroll. The game is definitely worth your cash, but also a little patience as it is early access and of course, there are bugs and several things needed to be worked out.--In Depth Review--Graphics: 7/10As you can imagine, worlds which are generated tend to look like they have been generated, rather than natural looking, but that's what makes the race tracks all the more fun than realistic, but the graphics in general are great with lovely lighting and shadows, incredible carcrash physics, lots of particles and bits of things flying everywhere, its great. There are however some major issues which lose the game some points here. There is always this kind of Dust Particle which approaches your screen at almost all times, which actually heats up the computer and in some cases, kills framerate even on powerful rigs like the one im running. Another issue is that large car crashes or great moments of vehicle damage causes the game's framerate to take a divebomb down to like 2 frames per second, which often forces you to kill the game and lose your progress. It's still early access so it's very easy to understand that this sorta thing will happen :)Sound: 10/10Countless games fall victim to a lack of sountrack, a lack of variation, and a lack of adrenaline and emotion to boot, but this game features a large playlist of music, each which will pump up your heart rate and convince you to keep driving and keep smacking people off their bike, the wonderful track lineup really keeps you playing the game so you can listen to them all. I hope in the future, like all games that have featured a kickass playlist (MAX Power Racing, Wipeout 2097 etc etc), will allow you to change track in the Pause menu, because i want to play my favorites over and over again! Maybe they could add buttons to utilize 'Next Track' and 'Previous Track' compatability. Weapons feel so realistic whenever you're in combat, from the sound of slapping meat to teeth-grinding chings of an iron weapon meeting someones skull, it sounds terrifyingly good. I have absolutely nothing to suggest when it comes to their sound lineup.Gameplay: 6/10It feels immidiately familiar to Road Rash players and brings back some well needed nostalgia, adding to what is an adrenaline filled game where every gut wrenching moment you fear for traffic over a hill knocking you off your bike, to battling a horde of cop cars and bikes, to avoiding the bullets and melee tools of an opponent biker and for the love of god keep your eyes on the road else you wont last long :D even the race track is twisty, bendy, requires sharp turns, and wants to kill you. It's very difficult doing all of this at once, but that's the beauty of this game and ones like it in the past, it NEEDS to be difficult and challenging...well it certainly is, sometimes feeling even unfair andd cruelly hard when actually sometimes there is nothing to do when you have been overwhelmed but try to stay alive. My only issue is that Police Cars are far too aggressive, where if a single police car hassles you from the beginning of a race, it is too easy and fast for that car to absolutely obliterate you and you dont always have a gun or powerful weapon to deal with it, making your entire race like trying to push or outrun Superman. As i have already mentioned, this game is hard, VERY hard, which is where i would like to suggest a Difficulty option, so that not-so-skilled players, or casuals can drive on easier tracks, with less aggressive AI and perhaps play a more casual and fun game.There is a lack of Online multiplayer and game-modes right now, but give it some time as there already are plans to include them. It is very likely in the future, the 6 rating i have given, will turn into an 8 or 9 after it has been more developed on :)Overall: 7/10   (after development you could even see up to 9/10)You can tell the game is still early access with several bugs, cars suddenly driving on the incorrect lanes, particle and physical framerate slowdowns and ruthless Car AI, but after these are fixed and more game-modes are included, i would hope with a difficulty slider so people can play at their own pace and level, this game is definitely on it's way to being an instant classic, relivving old memories of games long forgotten but better. The development team are very generous, are listening to community feedback, and are hopefully working hard on this title, because Road Redemption if it continues on this path, is going to be a rolling success. It's just missing one thing, YOU.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								Definately has a "Road Warrior" vibe to it. Game is fun and straight forward. Controls are a bit confusing at first but pause the game to find out how to nitro. To fire the gun, you hit the RB which is a little hard to do while driving. I might suggest moving that over to the X or Y buttons since you can't swing your gun anyway. The upgrades are interesting too. You get cash which allows you to upgrade items until you die. When you die, you use your experience to get perminant upgrades and you loose the ones you got with cash. A bit confusing at the start but you will figure it out after a few goes. Overall a great game with a lot of potential grown to be something amazing. A little short and easy right now but that is to be expected.

content:

Early Access Review
								The best and most promising thing I've seen to come from Early Access.I love the Road Rash style combat mixed with the over the top environments the game has to offer.You'll find yourself racing in raining cars or on top of skyscrapers, all while kicking and pushing others off the track.It's very addicting and satisfying racing/combat.Only real issue I had was that in the mayhem of the game the FPS would dip on my high end card.My ideas on things to add:  I would like to see some customization for the vehicle/playerA Custom Race option would be nice too

To fire the gun, you hit the RB which is a little hard to do while driving. I might suggest moving that over to the X or Y buttons since you can't swing your gun anyway. The upgrades are interesting too. You get cash which allows you to upgrade items until you die. When you die, you use your experience to get perminant upgrades and you loose the ones you got with cash. A bit confusing at the start but you will figure it out after a few goes. Overall a great game with a lot of potential grown to be something amazing. A little short and easy right now but that is to be expected.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Cons:  * It's early access, so you'll run into some moderately inconvenient bugs  * It's early access, so the game hasn't really been optimized yet.  As a result, in order to get the game to run smoothly, you'll need a great graphics card, or you'll need to turn the graphics settings down quite a bit (though, even the lowest settings still look good enough for me)Pros:Imagine that you are in a city of skyscrapers, driving on a motorcycle from rooftop to rooftop.  You pull up along another cycling and kick his bike.  He plummets to his doom.Then, you take out an AK-47 and mow down two more of your fellow rooftop jockeys just for the fun of it.  Their ragdolled bodies tumble off of the vehicles and quickly trodden upon by the other racers.  No one is bothered by this.As the race goes on, you attempt to jump a gap but realize that you don't quite have enough speed to make it.  You take out your harpoon and luckily land a shot on another biker, simultaneously engaging your jump jets to get some more air while you parasitically use your unwitting host's speed to pull yourself across the gap.Once your tires are again on solid rooftop, you drive up alongside the man who just inadvertently saved your life and club him in the head with a pipe.  A man has been murdered this day, but you feel only joy for it.Now, a storm cloud looms overhead and it begins to literally rain cars.  The rooftop race course has become an ever-changing minefield shiny metal boxes.  Feeling misanthropic, you grab one of the other riders and force his bike onto a path straight into one of the skyborn cars, killing him.  He was helpless to resist.  Another of the bikers is feeling high and mighty to have cheated death in the car storm—or so you assume—but you seek to bring him back down to earth.  You drive up alongside him and plant C4 on his vehicle before speeding away.  Within seconds, he and a nearby driver have both been incinerated in the explosion, sending their vehicles flying and creating yet more dangerous obstacles for the other racers behind you.  You speed off uncaringly.As it turns out, you feel empowered by all of this, and you repeat these acts over and over again—always killing—always thirsting for more.  It never seems to get old.Sounds awesome, right?  That's because it is!  This game is amazing!  Stop wasting your time reading these stupid reviews and buy it already!(P.S. The soundtrack is also pretty great.)

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								More satisfying then Sniper EliteDid you ever play Road Rash? Did you like it? If so then this game is for you. Buy it immediately.This game takes Road Rash, a motorcycle racing game with violence, gives it more modern graphics, and then kicks it up a few notches. It's got all the basics. Bludgeoning your enemies, kicking them into oncoming traffic, grabbing them and forcing them into obstacles, shooting them, etc. All your normal, violent, motorcycle race needs. But that's just the beginning.A few levels in you might experience cars dropping from the sky. Why? Hell if I know. But man does it cause a lot of destruction. On level 4 your bike gets Jump Jets. Congratulations, you can now jump several dozen feet in the air. Sound crazy? It's not. Mostly it's just useful. It's also fun as hell. Beginning on Level 5 you start racing across skyscraper rooftops, and yes, it's as fun as it sounds. More fun in fact because you get a grappling hook that allows you to swing your way to victory. The only downside is that it's a bit hard to use. But when you do use it, man do you soar through the air.And it just keeps going. The current last level is fantastic. I shall refrain from spoiling it and just say that it is a racing game classic and everyone will get a kick out of it. Or hate it. But in a loving, nostailgic way. Future updates will provide more levels I assume.As far as mechanics go, it's decently solid. There's an upgrade system, and a shop. You only keep your money and shop items until you die, but upgrades are permenant. Most controls aren't explained super well, but a quick look at the pause menu will give you all you need.I decided to leave the things I didn't like for last, mostly because some if not all of them are likely to change.-I'm not sure how keyboard/mouse controls are, so I would look into that if you don't have a controller. -The game lags severely on my lower end machine. Going off of looks alone it shouldn't be lagging so bad. Either there's a LOT of computing going on or it's just unoptimized. Hopefully that gets better.-Cars are too strong on early levels where you have weaker weapons. They force you off the road and while you can melee or shoot them, it takes a decent amount depending on the car. Especially police cars.-Aiming mode camera needs to have an option to snapback to defaultAll in all it's a good damn game. You should check it out.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought this game before it was on Steam when it was more or less just a tech demo which I much enjoyed playing, was it worth $15-$20 for the state it was in? No, not really but it showed potential to be a good game with the insanity that it tossed at you and for me was worth the purchase since I don't mind risking a bit of money here and there on unfinished products so long as the developer or publisher have not had issues with delievering with this model before (Double Fine). It is now further into "Early Access" and I can safely say that even if it doesn't gain much from what it is currently it is worth picking up as long as your not on a really tight budget, it controls great and doesn't fail to toss insanity at you around every bin.My only major complaint about it in its current state is that a lot of the races are mostly on one of two over used tracks, it would be nice to see a bit more varriety in the tracks though you don't really mind it to much when its litteritly raining cars down onto the track as cars drive any which way on the road creating massive wreaks to try to drive through while you try to kill rival gang member and come in 1st in a race all at the same time, or try to take down 7 rival gang members as you hop from building to building with a jet jump and grapling hook to get around.Only buy the game if you don't mind buying incomplete products hoping they don't drop the ball, don't mind seeing the same track many times, and like stupid levels of insanity in your games. Don't buy the game (yet) if you mind buying incomplete products, hate seeing the same track over and over even if it feels different each time with different challenges and AI to complete and deal with (traffic on the right side only, traffic on both sides going the right way, traphic on both sides going in random directions causing massive wreaks, traffic raining from the sky are but a few of the ways that the level can be the same but different), or if you like regular racing games because this games appeal is the insanity so don't expect any of the races to be fair or something you can memorize.

								So far it is definitely a fun game and worth the money but there are things I was expecting from a road rash clone that just weren't there like the bike shop. As far as I know you can't get busted when you wreck by a cop which really takes the thrill out of taking down the cop before he takes you down, really the cops in this game are just like any other biker just with a different skin. You pretty much start every mission with a weapon instead of having to earn it by grabbing one from an opponent so that old feeling of "♥♥♥♥ YEAH I JUST GOT THE CHAIN!!!!" is gone. So far it is feeling more like the crappy GBA version more than the awesome genesis/3DO versions of road rash. content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Previously I gave this game a 'no' review. There have been some changes that have made the game playable and even enjoyable. The physics of the bike in the air is ridiculous... but then again so is the whole idea of the game. There is some satisfaction to be had in planting a bomb on a rival gang member's bike or grappling them until they are hit by an on-coming car. Then there's the 'cars raining from the sky' which isn't a bug but an actual developers' choice for a thing to be happening while you are trying to dodge cars and bikers.The biggest issue at the moment on my system is that the game crashes out when trying to load levels. This appears to be due to the game using up all available memory and can be delayed by setting it at the the graphics to 'fastest'. The developers are aware of this and are trying to sort it out.As this game has no plot it can be very satisfying to just jump in a race, smash of few bikers down and then walk away. The weapons have different characteristics and learning to time the strikes is interesting.I wouldn't say the game is worth $20 in its current state but, with the effort being put in to fix the errors, I would say that it will be.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best "Early Access" game I've ever played. Not even a contest.Remember "Road Rash?" This feels like Road Rash - truly. And if you're too young to remember the original, let me explain what that means: Intuitive, easy-to-pickup motorcycle racing controls mixed with ridiculously entertaining violence. Is another racer pulling up next to you, about to hit you in the face with a baseball bat? Kick him into oncoming traffic. It feels good. It feels real good.Melee weapons are here, of course, but the addition of guns and explosives make for a novel twist to the old formula. And most importantly, I like the way the guns feel. It doesn't feel impossible to aim while driving; The skill came rather quickly, honestly. Automatic weapons are great for taking out small packs of enemy racers, while single-shot weapons make picking off one at a time - even from a distance - possible, and satisfying.I have almost 700 games right now, not counting free-to-plays, and this is the one I keep going back to when I have a half an hour to kill.Buy the game. Buy it. It's $20 bucks while it's in "Early Access," and it's already worth twice as much - so after it's done and they raise the price, it'll still easily be worth the money.Buy it. You won't be disappointed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game, despite it's hype of bringing back a game that was formely road rash, a game franchise that was massively popular in the 90's, doesn't seem to live up to the hype of the original. By playing or rather trying to play this game for roughly an hour, I spent the better part of that hour frustratingly trying to get my pc gamepad to work with it and even with using the input settings, some of which i'll admit were rather frustrating, in the end did not work.Searching for an answer via the internet I have discovered that an xbox360 controller works just fine on the PC, however I don't have an XBOX360 controller and simply refuse to buy one either. One gamepad for each and every game should work, PERIOD. Not just a specific one.In the end I tried playing with a keyboard and mouse and had limited success, controls are laggy and sometimes the screen freezes when an enemy is killed. It's also rather difficult to make hard or sharp turns when the bike itself even at the very 1st level seems rather sluggish and feels like I need to turn my own body to will it to go left and right.In hindsight, the game reacts and moves just like the old road rash games in that retrospect if you wanted a bit of frustrating nostalga,  however I was hoping for a smoother and better gaming experience that actually and equally goes with the change in the times and of gaming. There is also quite a delayed effect with trying to take the enemies down with weapons, infact its increasingly frustrating, because when you click the left or right mouse button, you expect an immediate reaction, but much like the steering and general incompetance of the game, it too is increasingly slow and delayed.So all in all? Doesn't work with any gamepad except an x360 controller, laggy and slow on turns and attacking, even more frustrating and difficult to play on your keyboard/mouse and quite frankly isn't worth the £15 I spent for it on steam.Yes it looked amazing via youtube and the gamers that reviewed it gave it major props but I still can't help but feel like I've been decieved. Still regardless of my 1st hr impressions of it, no matter how negative they maybe, I'm not going to completely give up on it until I've given it more time, maybe try tweeking it a bit. Till then? Who knows?

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Heres the thing about this game. It still needs a ton of work but not in the areas youd expect. It has all the components it needs to be a fantastic game but its just... not balanced right. For example take the mission set up. Its completely random. So you could start off with the kill a bunch of cops mission but have like an axe and the first 2-3 waves of cops you drive through are cars. (Hint: You cant kill cars with an axe) Or there are races but you start off like 10 seconds behind everyone. Its not like you cant still win but thats just weird. What makes it worse is that at random any map might get the raining cars mod. So you start off at the back and then have to play catch up while cars rain from the sky. And Im not talking one or two, Im talking like a heavy downpour. Then you get a stupid mission (imo) of kill a certain amount of riders, USING NO WEAPONS! Not impossible by any means but a stupid limiter for campaign. Now it does come up where you can use weapons and that I like but when it flips to no weapons it just feels like a lazy way to make this game challenging.Now all those things I hate about this game could turn around and become the things I will love about it in the future if the creator can balance it right. Right now the scale is tipped towards bad. But even with that I still love this game and can't wait for the future.Stuff you need to know:1) Story mode isnt finished, stops about 3/4 across the country2) Dont get to choose your bike, just upgrade it in a general sense. Really hope that changes.3)If you fail to complete the task of that level but it gives you the option to retry, it doesnt reset your stats to what they were when you started that level but leaves them at what what they were when you failed. So good luck/♥♥♥♥ yourself?4)You dont get to build your gang at all and for the most part they dont show up in levels.5)I know I said story mode isnt finished but its like its not even started. The levels are random and Im not sure how anything you do ties in with the story explained on the store page.6)Cars will butt ram you off the road and there is ♥♥♥♥ all you can do to stop it except slow down and pray your not near something that will kill you7)Still love this game.One last thing. I think in its current state its not worth the 20 bucks. If I were to price it Id say 10-15 bucks tops but Im still happy with my purchase.Edit: Grammer and such.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Road Redemption. Holy crap, this game is absolutely AMAZING. It's so fun and addictive that I had to keep coming back to it everyday! I love the feeling when you smash a baseball bat straight in someones face, or when you launch them sky high with a Sticky Bomb or Grenade Launcher.I've never played Road Rash, but I will say that you do not need to play that game to enjoy this. I had a great time shooting people off their bikes while flying in the air on rooftops while zip lining from helicopter to helicopter. All the different areas are long and very entertaining, especially when you're destroying everything in sight.This game however, can be difficult. Car storms are challenging, fun and frustrating to drive through, while crazy traffic causes mass mayhem and destruction, but it doesn't stop there. Once you beat the normal Campaign (1-3 hours depending on how good you are) you unlock Campaign+ and holy crap, it's hard.The Gameplay overall is awesome, fun, challenging and sometimes aggravating. It will keep you entertained for sometime. The great thing about this is, even though there's only about 3-7 Hours of play, the game is has a lot of replay-ability, with having almost all the levels different each time, with a leveling up system that works pretty nice. Plus, the game is still being developed with a competitive mode in development!Now for the look of the game, the graphics are really good. The texture quality could be improved a bit, and there should be a bit more optimizations rather than the normal Unity start up menu,  but that's just something I'd prefer.The Shadow quality is pretty good as well, but it could be improved upon a bit as well.Overall, a great game with great graphics, great gameplay and lots of replay-ability. A must have for all those people who love destruction and fast paced gameplay.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought this game hoping for Road Rash. I was not disappointed.At its core, Road Redemption has some extremely simple mechanics: Drive a motorcycle across some ridiculous procedurally generated terrain (the use of 'terrain' rather than 'roads' is definitely intentional) and beat other bikers with pipes and whatnot. If you liked Road Rash, this game will likely be right up your alley.The procedurally generated 'tracks' are really well-done - they flow well, and they're varied enough to stay interesting. Let's be honest, it doesn't take a lot of track variety to make racing games work - many of them involve going around in circles for an hour, and that's fine. I was rather pleasantly surprised by how many little shortcuts and environmental quirks there were to find on these tracks.There's missions to play through in a level-by-level system - each level presents some challenge... taking down other riders, winning a race, attracting the attention of the police, etc. You don't have to complete the challenge to pass the level, though doing so gets you some cash that you can spend on upgrades. These upgrades persist until you die, at which point you get a 'game over', and the next time you play, you're starting again from the beginning, but you also earn experience points which can be spent to buy persistent upgrades.Each level is relatively short - 3-5 minutes, generally - so it's definitely an accessible game... you don't need hours of time to make it feel 'worth it' to play.There's a wide range of weapons, including both melee (pipes, axes, maces, sticks, wrenches, etc.), ranged (pistols, rifles, harpoons, a grappling hook), and some special cases (dynomite, a grenade launcher, etc.), and they all have either ammo or durability. When you've run out of ammo or durability, the weapon is discarded. You can carry 3 or 4 with you, and they're very commonly obtained during the game (and sometimes between levels), so you don't feel like you have to be conservative, and you get to play with a wide variety of weapon types. In addition to the weapons, you have a kick and grab attack.The riding physics are very arcadey in nature, but honestly, if you looked at the description for this game and expected a realistic biking sim, you might need professional help. You have fairly good air control when you take jumps (you can turn in mid-air), and crashing into a car, flying off your bike, skidding 200m on the pavement, then falling into a ravine does far less damage than being hit in the head with a pipe, but this is a good thing - it keeps the game fun.There are some quirks, though. The physics can be a little weird in some cases, especially when going off the road is involved. The side-to-side collisions feel a little 'bouncy', and sometimes the camera angles can cause problems when you're in mid-crash and trying to recover.I feel like the game could benefit greatly from a few other game modes, but I'm chalking the absence of such things up to it being early access. Some sort of 'endless' mode where you're just trying to see how long you can stay alive would be very fun, here.The controls are very tight, especially if you use a controller.The game is a little rough around the edges, but this seems more the result of it being an early access title than poor decision making on the developers' part. Overall, I'd highly recommend this game if you enjoyed Road Rash or like similar arcade racing-combat games.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Remember Road Rash? Kind of? Okay, that’s good enough. The homicidal motorcycle racing genre never went stale. Instead, it kind of never went anywhere. Those games died on the side of some infinite stretch of desolate highway in the late ‘90s. Luckily, the people at DarkSeas flipped open their Necronomicon and decided to revive the genre with Road Redemption and I couldn’t be happier. It’s at least ten times the skull busting, engine revving, cap popping, and jump jetting you can remember.Set in a world where cars can, and occasionally will, rain from the sky, this is the Road Rashiest rehash you could possibly envision. Calling it a tribute doesn’t even do it justice. Road Redemption does more for this niche racing genre than any game before it. It’s nearly perfect and, technically, not even a finished product. Part roguelike, part RPG, and all high-octane violence, this game is both incredibly easy to get into and difficult to perfect. Careen across skyscrapers and swerve around crumbled competition – there are a ton of surprises folded into this title. Pure entertainment and a “must own” for old-school fans.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Iron meets flesh as my spanner introduces itself to Officer Mustache's jaw bone. He knew what he was getting into when he joined the force.  Officer Friendly opens the throttle in an attempt for revenge, but I flip the nitrous and my bike screams to life. My hands shake from the adrenalin and dopamine, this is better than any pilfered drug.My comms activate: "Kill all gang members with kicks and grabs!" It occurs to me that the Brotherhood of Jackals only pilot semi-trucks these days. I had been wondering why my brothers had been calling me "Sabin."Cars and trucks begin falling from the sky. Their passengers screaming, but no sound is heard. A Jackal member smashes headfirst into a fallen minivan and explodes in a shower of body panels and entrails. Swing music begins playing over my helmet headset. I turn the radio up to 11 and take off in 1st gear.This is my road to redemption.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
Early Access Review
My first review on 28 Sep @ 11:15pmI know it's early access, but i want to believe that the game is in very (very) early development. Pre-alpha or something. This game was advertised as "Road Rash Reborn" or something like that, but all i was able to see is "Mario Kart with Bikes". The game is very fun, i give you that. But the modeling is poor, the physics is poor. There's no bike selection and the maps although it's proceduraly generated, it bugs a lot. And personally, i don't like the car storm and neither the traffic in the rooftops. This is my temp review. I want to see (the said) improvements in the next update.My second review on 09 Oct @ 9:03pmA lot had improved since my first review. Stability, gameplay, etc. Nice to see the game acquiring it's form and getting polished.The producers also contacted me and really wanted to hear what i had to suggest. It was very thoughtful. I gave a lot of feedback and hope to have helped them. :)

content:

Early Access Review
								If you remember the sega Road Rash classic fondly you will greatly enjoy this game.  Up to 4 player COOP was a huge selling point for me, and makes this an easy to pick up party game.  I recently beat the game and was rewarded with a phone number which I absurdly called and was connected directly to a developer.  A super nice guy I chatted wth him a bit longer that was probably approprite, I had been drinking (thanks for your patience Ian).  All in all a great game.  How often can you say, "Then a car fell out of the sky, luckily I used my jump jets to boost over it and when I landed I kicked another dude off a bridge, shot my girlfriend  with a grenade launcher and won the race."  Yeah, I'm pretty bad♥♥♥♥♥

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Hard to say whether the game is good or not. Reviving the epic Road Rash is a great idea, but for people like me who are nostalgic to the childhood memory may feel a bit disappointed. As long as I remember, one of the best thing about Road Rash is the unlimited freedom it gives to the player, e.g. you can simply drop you motor and run all the way the finish line, however the freedom is absent from Road Redemption.First the new game runs in a much faster pace with much shorter tracks, which leaves the players busily doging coming veichles and runs like hell to the finish line, no time is left for more fun. Secondly the player dies far too easily: either you get hit by a car coming into your face (waaaay too much traffic!), or a car dropped randomly from the sky, or simply got slashed by a axe two times. I would still stick to the idea that you could pick up your bike and ride on when you got seriously damaged. Then it is the optimization issue. The game is supposed to be affordable even for mid tier laptops, but with a brand new MSI with a GeForce 970M GPU I still experience some significant PFS drop. Finally, is it really neccessary to have some troll events like Hallucinogen*****, or to let the player compete with a car? I have already have Goat Simulator so I truly don't need another game just like that, especially for a game that I wish I could invest more time in.For the pros, the game has some really good level designs, for which I mean level 4 where you can compete on the rooftop with a jet pack on your rear wheel. I did not get to all the campaign levels but I believe there will be more surprise to come.To note that this is an alpha version so there is still a lot that can be improved. With a fantastic initial concept I am hoping for future updates. So with my expectation high on this I will give it a yes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Described as the spiritual sequel to Road Rash, Road Redemption is a fast paced motorbike riding katana wielding pile up of a wild ride. From zooming down motorways to leaping between rooftops the gameplay will definitely remind you of your days playing the old road rash series. This time around however, there is no bike shop, and no story mode. The campaign is a series of randomly generated missions that give you cash which you can spend on items such as increased health or weapon damage. However, if you die while playing, you lose all your progress except for any experience gained. You can spend this experience on persistent upgrades such as improved health or bikes.All in all a pretty enjoyable game especially considering that its still in early access. Its early access state is still obvious while playing however, everything has a work in progress feel. Fortunately the core gameplay is pretty well nailed down, so if they continue building the game around this it could be even better upon release.The game also features 4 way split screen and controller compatibility, so local multiplayer is currently possible, and it looks like online multiplayer is on the horizon.As with all early access games, only time will tell as to whether the finished product is worth your pennies, and in some cases, whether the game will actually be completed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well what is there to say about such a simple yet amazing game. to start off with if you are looking for an addictive upgrade game then look no further and buy this one!First off the game mechanics are very simple yet so strategic and tacticle. you have multiple moves you can use to get other riders off their bikes and an arsonal of weapons at your disposal and each weapon feels and plays differently, if its more range or more power or both together,The game offers a campaign and a campaign+. you could effectivly complete the campaign in one fell swoop and it would be very short VERY UNLIKELY. this game is very challanging and requires you to pay a lot of attention and i kid you not, in later levels you will be alive or dead judging on a split secound move. when you get the hang of the game and have upgraded enough to last longer you will get such a buzz from dodging debree and flying cars ect ect. there are many game modes to keep you entertained and its always random in a campaign.The down sides of the game only come with the brand "early access, i mean these down sides are so small that they could be fixed within the next day from me writing this so they may not even be there.Co-op play is brilliant fun riding around with some mates in split screen madness, not enough games offer this on PC but i feel it was another selling point for me, HOWEVER during the upgrade screen you can heal your rider but you cant see the 2nd players health bar so you don't know if he needs healing. you also share the same pool of money and both get the same upgrades, im not saying this is a bad point but it kind of makes player 2 feel more like an extention than a player in the game.FPS, throughout the game the FPS is brilliant. HOWEVER at some rare moment later on in the game where hell is brought down on earth, the FPS can drop and this makes the game a little tricky considerng every secound counts. however the FPS drop lasts for around 3 to 4 secounds and thats it.as i say these SMALL issues can be fixed easily and i beleave there will be a competative mode coming soon so there is more to look for. this game is addictive frstratingly challanging, has some seriouse replay value and i would say 9.3/10 Love it.

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is very unique. The devs are highly respectable; caring about the community's input of the game. They are constantly working on it. The game is currently worth the buy because it doesn't have much of a problem with bugs and if you ever get stuck you can hit ESC > "Put me on the track."I recommend this game to anyone who doesn't mind doing a little bit of grinding.The good thing about it? It isn't repetitive, as grinding normally is. You start with the lowest of low stuff.. Bike, weapon, etc is all low.Once you get a feel for the game you can drive through and dodge cars, smash other people off their bikes with maces, bats, sledgehammers, tomahawks.. and eventually shotguns and grenade launchers.The game has a nice combat system in which you can deflect (with timing) an AI's attack and your next attack will be critical. I want to see what they will do with multiplayer.. and I hope WE won't be disappointed.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Heres the thing about this game. It still needs a ton of work but not in the areas youd expect. It has all the components it needs to be a fantastic game but its just... not balanced right. For example take the mission set up. Its completely random. So you could start off with the kill a bunch of cops mission but have like an axe and the first 2-3 waves of cops you drive through are cars. (Hint: You cant kill cars with an axe) Or there are races but you start off like 10 seconds behind everyone. Its not like you cant still win but thats just weird. What makes it worse is that at random any map might get the raining cars mod. So you start off at the back and then have to play catch up while cars rain from the sky. And Im not talking one or two, Im talking like a heavy downpour. Then you get a stupid mission (imo) of kill a certain amount of riders, USING NO WEAPONS! Not impossible by any means but a stupid limiter for campaign. Now it does come up where you can use weapons and that I like but when it flips to no weapons it just feels like a lazy way to make this game challenging.Now all those things I hate about this game could turn around and become the things I will love about it in the future if the creator can balance it right. Right now the scale is tipped towards bad. But even with that I still love this game and can't wait for the future.Stuff you need to know:1) Story mode isnt finished, stops about 3/4 across the country2) Dont get to choose your bike, just upgrade it in a general sense. Really hope that changes.3)If you fail to complete the task of that level but it gives you the option to retry, it doesnt reset your stats to what they were when you started that level but leaves them at what what they were when you failed. So good luck/♥♥♥♥ yourself?4)You dont get to build your gang at all and for the most part they dont show up in levels.5)I know I said story mode isnt finished but its like its not even started. The levels are random and Im not sure how anything you do ties in with the story explained on the store page.6)Cars will butt ram you off the road and there is ♥♥♥♥ all you can do to stop it except slow down and pray your not near something that will kill you7)Still love this game.One last thing. I think in its current state its not worth the 20 bucks. If I were to price it Id say 10-15 bucks tops but Im still happy with my purchase.Edit: Grammer and such.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Road Redemption. Holy crap, this game is absolutely AMAZING. It's so fun and addictive that I had to keep coming back to it everyday! I love the feeling when you smash a baseball bat straight in someones face, or when you launch them sky high with a Sticky Bomb or Grenade Launcher.I've never played Road Rash, but I will say that you do not need to play that game to enjoy this. I had a great time shooting people off their bikes while flying in the air on rooftops while zip lining from helicopter to helicopter. All the different areas are long and very entertaining, especially when you're destroying everything in sight.This game however, can be difficult. Car storms are challenging, fun and frustrating to drive through, while crazy traffic causes mass mayhem and destruction, but it doesn't stop there. Once you beat the normal Campaign (1-3 hours depending on how good you are) you unlock Campaign+ and holy crap, it's hard.The Gameplay overall is awesome, fun, challenging and sometimes aggravating. It will keep you entertained for sometime. The great thing about this is, even though there's only about 3-7 Hours of play, the game is has a lot of replay-ability, with having almost all the levels different each time, with a leveling up system that works pretty nice. Plus, the game is still being developed with a competitive mode in development!Now for the look of the game, the graphics are really good. The texture quality could be improved a bit, and there should be a bit more optimizations rather than the normal Unity start up menu,  but that's just something I'd prefer.The Shadow quality is pretty good as well, but it could be improved upon a bit as well.Overall, a great game with great graphics, great gameplay and lots of replay-ability. A must have for all those people who love destruction and fast paced gameplay.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
Early Access Review
My first review on 28 Sep @ 11:15pmI know it's early access, but i want to believe that the game is in very (very) early development. Pre-alpha or something. This game was advertised as "Road Rash Reborn" or something like that, but all i was able to see is "Mario Kart with Bikes". The game is very fun, i give you that. But the modeling is poor, the physics is poor. There's no bike selection and the maps although it's proceduraly generated, it bugs a lot. And personally, i don't like the car storm and neither the traffic in the rooftops. This is my temp review. I want to see (the said) improvements in the next update.My second review on 09 Oct @ 9:03pmA lot had improved since my first review. Stability, gameplay, etc. Nice to see the game acquiring it's form and getting polished.The producers also contacted me and really wanted to hear what i had to suggest. It was very thoughtful. I gave a lot of feedback and hope to have helped them. :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best "Early Access" game I've ever played. Not even a contest.Remember "Road Rash?" This feels like Road Rash - truly. And if you're too young to remember the original, let me explain what that means: Intuitive, easy-to-pickup motorcycle racing controls mixed with ridiculously entertaining violence. Is another racer pulling up next to you, about to hit you in the face with a baseball bat? Kick him into oncoming traffic. It feels good. It feels real good.Melee weapons are here, of course, but the addition of guns and explosives make for a novel twist to the old formula. And most importantly, I like the way the guns feel. It doesn't feel impossible to aim while driving; The skill came rather quickly, honestly. Automatic weapons are great for taking out small packs of enemy racers, while single-shot weapons make picking off one at a time - even from a distance - possible, and satisfying.I have almost 700 games right now, not counting free-to-plays, and this is the one I keep going back to when I have a half an hour to kill.Buy the game. Buy it. It's $20 bucks while it's in "Early Access," and it's already worth twice as much - so after it's done and they raise the price, it'll still easily be worth the money.Buy it. You won't be disappointed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game, despite it's hype of bringing back a game that was formely road rash, a game franchise that was massively popular in the 90's, doesn't seem to live up to the hype of the original. By playing or rather trying to play this game for roughly an hour, I spent the better part of that hour frustratingly trying to get my pc gamepad to work with it and even with using the input settings, some of which i'll admit were rather frustrating, in the end did not work.Searching for an answer via the internet I have discovered that an xbox360 controller works just fine on the PC, however I don't have an XBOX360 controller and simply refuse to buy one either. One gamepad for each and every game should work, PERIOD. Not just a specific one.In the end I tried playing with a keyboard and mouse and had limited success, controls are laggy and sometimes the screen freezes when an enemy is killed. It's also rather difficult to make hard or sharp turns when the bike itself even at the very 1st level seems rather sluggish and feels like I need to turn my own body to will it to go left and right.In hindsight, the game reacts and moves just like the old road rash games in that retrospect if you wanted a bit of frustrating nostalga,  however I was hoping for a smoother and better gaming experience that actually and equally goes with the change in the times and of gaming. There is also quite a delayed effect with trying to take the enemies down with weapons, infact its increasingly frustrating, because when you click the left or right mouse button, you expect an immediate reaction, but much like the steering and general incompetance of the game, it too is increasingly slow and delayed.So all in all? Doesn't work with any gamepad except an x360 controller, laggy and slow on turns and attacking, even more frustrating and difficult to play on your keyboard/mouse and quite frankly isn't worth the £15 I spent for it on steam.Yes it looked amazing via youtube and the gamers that reviewed it gave it major props but I still can't help but feel like I've been decieved. Still regardless of my 1st hr impressions of it, no matter how negative they maybe, I'm not going to completely give up on it until I've given it more time, maybe try tweeking it a bit. Till then? Who knows?

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Heres the thing about this game. It still needs a ton of work but not in the areas youd expect. It has all the components it needs to be a fantastic game but its just... not balanced right. For example take the mission set up. Its completely random. So you could start off with the kill a bunch of cops mission but have like an axe and the first 2-3 waves of cops you drive through are cars. (Hint: You cant kill cars with an axe) Or there are races but you start off like 10 seconds behind everyone. Its not like you cant still win but thats just weird. What makes it worse is that at random any map might get the raining cars mod. So you start off at the back and then have to play catch up while cars rain from the sky. And Im not talking one or two, Im talking like a heavy downpour. Then you get a stupid mission (imo) of kill a certain amount of riders, USING NO WEAPONS! Not impossible by any means but a stupid limiter for campaign. Now it does come up where you can use weapons and that I like but when it flips to no weapons it just feels like a lazy way to make this game challenging.Now all those things I hate about this game could turn around and become the things I will love about it in the future if the creator can balance it right. Right now the scale is tipped towards bad. But even with that I still love this game and can't wait for the future.Stuff you need to know:1) Story mode isnt finished, stops about 3/4 across the country2) Dont get to choose your bike, just upgrade it in a general sense. Really hope that changes.3)If you fail to complete the task of that level but it gives you the option to retry, it doesnt reset your stats to what they were when you started that level but leaves them at what what they were when you failed. So good luck/♥♥♥♥ yourself?4)You dont get to build your gang at all and for the most part they dont show up in levels.5)I know I said story mode isnt finished but its like its not even started. The levels are random and Im not sure how anything you do ties in with the story explained on the store page.6)Cars will butt ram you off the road and there is ♥♥♥♥ all you can do to stop it except slow down and pray your not near something that will kill you7)Still love this game.One last thing. I think in its current state its not worth the 20 bucks. If I were to price it Id say 10-15 bucks tops but Im still happy with my purchase.Edit: Grammer and such.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Road Redemption. Holy crap, this game is absolutely AMAZING. It's so fun and addictive that I had to keep coming back to it everyday! I love the feeling when you smash a baseball bat straight in someones face, or when you launch them sky high with a Sticky Bomb or Grenade Launcher.I've never played Road Rash, but I will say that you do not need to play that game to enjoy this. I had a great time shooting people off their bikes while flying in the air on rooftops while zip lining from helicopter to helicopter. All the different areas are long and very entertaining, especially when you're destroying everything in sight.This game however, can be difficult. Car storms are challenging, fun and frustrating to drive through, while crazy traffic causes mass mayhem and destruction, but it doesn't stop there. Once you beat the normal Campaign (1-3 hours depending on how good you are) you unlock Campaign+ and holy crap, it's hard.The Gameplay overall is awesome, fun, challenging and sometimes aggravating. It will keep you entertained for sometime. The great thing about this is, even though there's only about 3-7 Hours of play, the game is has a lot of replay-ability, with having almost all the levels different each time, with a leveling up system that works pretty nice. Plus, the game is still being developed with a competitive mode in development!Now for the look of the game, the graphics are really good. The texture quality could be improved a bit, and there should be a bit more optimizations rather than the normal Unity start up menu,  but that's just something I'd prefer.The Shadow quality is pretty good as well, but it could be improved upon a bit as well.Overall, a great game with great graphics, great gameplay and lots of replay-ability. A must have for all those people who love destruction and fast paced gameplay.

								"Hallucinogenic drug" mode... Cars drop out of the sky randomly, with no warning, cause totally unavoidable crashes (but the AI can usually avoid, of course.) Rooftop mode... Jumping from skyscraper to skyscraper, you have jetpacks, but they're only good for making minor corrections. Add more variety to the landscapes and maps instead of this asinine ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. It's another of these games that is ♥♥♥♥ing great at it's core, but then its one bad decision after another, and before you know it, you've buried that awesome core game in ten tons of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Sad!

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a difficult one for me. I love the days of Road Rash, was one of my favourite games growing up, and there's a lot to like about Road Redemption in comparison with it. Weapon variety is great, and the arcadey feel is in the ballpark of what I was hoping for. However, this game is very much early access. The content seems rather shallow and limited, it doesn't do a couple of big things which I considered great from the classic Road Rash games... which I hope will change as development goes on. Buggy as anything as well of course, and I'll forgive a lot of it (too easy to get stuck behind objects, I know there's the option in the menu to put you back on the track, but having it on the controller would make more sense) but the big down for me is that it crashed 3 times within just over an hours play. That's bad, even for an early access game (especially one which has been around for a fair bit).I'd like to say I recommend the game, but as it stands I can't. Of course, things will change as the game gets closer to release, and it's not one I've given up on either... there's enough fun there at its core that with a lot of work it will become more playable as time goes on.

And I would have gotten another refund if I hadn't already played it so much on Windows. So, naturally, I feel cheated!Conclusion: If you are a Windows user, you'll probably enjoy this game, it's a promising follow-up to the classic Road Rash game. If you are a Linux user, stay the heck away from this game, at least until it's on par with the Windows version, also, the developers hate you!

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
Early Access Review
July 18, 2015I think this is how Arkham Knight ran at launch. First boot, I almost think it's crashed, but finally the menu decides to show up for work. Dress code must be pretty lax here, as the UI looks like a placeholder. Probably is the case, as the Keybindings button is blanked and unusable. The background environments take me back to PS2 days, but it's Fastest graphics quality. Alright, no big deal, let's do this.Campaign supports 4 players locally, neat. I'll come to wonder how, eventually. 5 bikes, 2 of which look about the same in stats and looks. Shovel Knight character looks cool, let's go. OH GOD. Loading screen visuals make me think this is a mod, and the mission starts with no notice. No countdown to go, not even a quick overview of the controls and mechanics. Maybe it's supposed to be old-school, and you're supposed to read the manual? It's easy enough to play I guess, but WOW that framerate is schizophrenic. 1280x720 resolution, Fastest Quality, and a computer above Recommended specs, and I'm lucky to break 50 frames per second. Controls are a mess when frames are dropping and flying between 20 and 40 fps, and packed races can bring it to a halt. Trying to quit to play something else, it tops it all off with a crash to desktop, losing any XP progression I had. I gave it some extra time later, to see if things were a fluke. No changes, other than no other crashes. Maybe I came in after a bad patch, but it sounds like I'm not alone with issues on the forums.Aside from optimization and bugs, I'm really not impressed with the gameplay. Maybe there is more depth to the combat I haven't found, but I did alright just by attacking, moving aside so I never needed to deflect. Missions get pretty repetitive, along with the lifeless desert roads. The progression system is mostly stats, and nothing interesting, just a way to make the game harder until you grind more. I really haven't enjoyed the game to justify the $8 USD I spent on the sale, and I would be very disappointed at full price. Honestly, I don't think the game is ready to launch this year, unless the developers really go into overdrive before the end of the year. It has good potential, but the performance issues really held me back. Maybe it's just a small unlucky group having issues, but I really would've appreciated a demo to see how good/bad it ran for me. I jumped on the sale, expecting the game would easily be worth under $10 USD. Unfortunately I was mistaken. I should've looked at playtimes of more reviews, I think 16 hours is the most I've seen, and most people stop in a few hours. It's not nearly ready for launch, and the performance issues may mean you won't be able to enjoy the game properly. Check out videos to see if there is enough content for you to enjoy, and be careful. I've learned to treat Early Access games as effectively finalized, as you never know when progress will stop. I expect performance issues to improve, but I'm not certain all issues in the game will be fixed. More bikes/rider skins is NOT the solution.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Early Access - Jan 18th, 2015 updateRoad Redemption is an awesome game if you've been missing the good old Road Rash days. The game has some similarities to Road Rash but has a lot of unique featuers as well, such as vertical jump jets on your bikes in the city rooftop level, and a Just Cause 2 style hook shot thing. The game is also somewhat Roguelike-ish in how it plays, with perma death on your rider, but also letting you upgrade your character for the next attempt.I've played it before and loaded it up again after multiple updates and found the game is even better than I remember. The graphics are great and with updates the performance issues are greatly improved. The music is fantastic and gets you pumped for kicking♥♥♥♥♥on the streets, and the sound effects have been improved and are even better now.Oh yeah, you can race as Shovel Knight now, awesome!Great variety of weapons, melee as well as guns & even C4. The guns are a little hard to control while trying to maintain your place on the road and not wipe out in a corner or on some moron driving their car into you, hopefully things improve on the guns and aiming. I'm not really worried though, because every time I go back to play this it has been updated and is even better than before.Still waiting on the multiplayer, and I think that will be incredible when it comes in. The game itself is fun to play and even has up to 4 player local co-op, but the campaign still feels a bit lacking. I'm not sure what it is, but it needs something to tie the races together, a story or something. You are racing and it's great fun, but you don't really know why you are racing, and the levels - while being fun - don't segway into each other and feel like instead of doing a campaign you have to do 10 random levels then do the last level. I am certain this will be address in the final version, and it is still in early access, so we'll just have to wait and see.All that said, this game is awesome. If you liked Road Rash, and you also like Roguelike games, this is a gooder!If you're not into early access, than definitely come back and check it out after the full release.


YouTube™ Video: Road Redemption - Early Access Update Jan 18th, 2015 

			Views: 179		

			Road Redemption is still in Early Access but has been getting quite a few updates over the past while, and just got one yesterday so I thought I would throw it on and see how it's doing.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								Whether you recall the original this is modeled after or not, I absolutely have to recommend Road Redemption for sheer mayhem and gameplay which is nothing other than pure fun.  When is the last time you almost threw your controller - while laughling ?  It's a game in which the sheer randomness it creates frequently results in unbelievably intense, or humorous (or both) moments.  Yeah, it's got some things I'm sure that motorcycle driving purists won't like (you can steer and accel/decel-erate in mid-air, for instance), and some gui weirdness (sometimes your opponents somehow end up being cars - and sometimes you can outrun the placement of cars and bike npc's, for instance) -- but if you don't expect perfection, this game has pure old school edge of your seat bash-n-dash down to a T.  The maps are fun, and frankly I still can't keep any but the starter bike on the road...As-is currently in early access, the content is somewhat limited but is very replayable - I sincerely hope this ends up being completed and released to the masses, we deserve this game.  And if multiplayer ever becomes real, welcome to my new favorite past-time.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Okay, so a funny and unexpected thing happened. I was friended by the developer of this game who told me they take these reviews very seriously and that the newest patch addressed several of the things I brought up. So already I'm liking these guys more, BUTThen I actually loaded up the game, and I was very pleasantly surprised. This game feels great. The handling is responsive, and the bikes feel like they have more weight. This makes the combat a lot more enjoyable just because you begin to feel like you have control over things.And the more I played the more I enjoyed myself. I still have misgivings about the procedural generation as I would rather see memorable tracks, but I think my issues with the handling were a large part of my dislike of that.The game still has a way to go, but that's what early access is for. And based on the way the developer handles criticism, I can't help but trust they'll make this game great.So, I admit it; I was wrong. If you're a fan of Road Rash, this IS the game for you.==OLD REVIEW==As much as I want to love this game, after playing it for a few hours I find myself increasingly bored. The procedural generation makes the tracks completely non-sensical and bland, the combat is only occasionally engaging, and the driving itself is completely unsatisfying.Levels like the races on rooftops and the races with cars falling from the sky seem like the result of a 14-year-old saying "Oh man, you know what would be AWESOME?" with no regard to actually making it play well.I've been coming back to this after each update and at this point it's clear to me that the flaws to this game run so deep that there's no real way to fix them.If you buy this, don't expect a "deep, satisfying 10-15 hour experience" but a shallow and aimless 2 hour playthrough after which you'll be left wanting so, so much more.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
Early Access Review
Skip to the bottom to the verdict if you want a quick summaryThe GoodHuge nostalgia for fans of road rash. Not EXACTLY like Road Rash but still very, very simular. If you liked Road Rash you're probably going to love this game.Both keyboard and xbox controls work well with this game. If you own a different controller and still want to play the devs have a guide HereDriving is smooth and you have a lot of control over your motorcycle. It's easy to steer and the controls are simple.The map design is great. From driving on mountains to driving on rooftops this game's environment sucks you in and makes you feel like a part of the action. At the end there is one special map to finish it off which is definitely a great finale (as of early access).There's a good variety of weapons in the game and they all make you feel like a badass.Shovel Knight makes an appearance with his very own Shovel Bike and of course starts with a shovel as his weapon! The graphics are pretty nice once you get in a race and I haven't come across any issues with FPS so optimisation is so far so good.Campaign+ adds a good challenge after you've beaten the original campaign.The devs update the game frequently with bug fixes and help the community over the steam forums, e-mails and even over the phone!Last but not least, the music in this game is so good.The BadThe menu design for the pause menu, the loading screen and the pre-race screen are pretty terrible. Especially the loading screen. Loading does take some time (~5-10 seconds for me) and looking at a dull grey background just ruins the atmosphere for me.No Multiplayer yet (21/06/15 UK) but it is something I am looking forward to. MULTIPLAYER WILL BE ADDED IN THE FUTURE.There's a few crashes around BUT the good thing about this is that the devs fix them regularly and even give instructions on how to report crashes.My SuggestionsI would love to see a few more maps, bikes and characters.A Melee-Weapons only mode, it does make the races a bit too easy when you're sticking c4 on everyone.Improve the menu and loading screen designs.Mods! After playing that last race, imagine what the community could do if they could create their own maps, characters and bikes ;)The VerdictA road to nostalgia for all of the Road Rash fans and even if you didn't play Road Rash then this game's your way to do that (not entirely but you get the idea). Great music, amazing level design and a unique motorcycle racing game.  If you ever wanted to get 1st place my kicking your opponent off a cliff whilst riding a bike as shovel knight, you can do that. Highly recommend this game.Worth? - The game is worth the whole £15. A reasonable price for a great game. I picked it up for £4 and would have easily payed £15 if I knew it was this good.Rating - 8/10
